Greetings to Turkish President
articles.content:
Greetings to Turkish President 
    Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Ahmed Necdet Sezer, president of the Republic of Turkey, on Oct. 25 on the occasion of the day of the proclamation of the republic.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the mutual interests of the two peoples, the message wished the president and people of Turkey greater successes in their work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Czech President
articles.content:
Greetings to Czech President 
    Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Vaclav Klaus, president of the Czech Republic, on Thursday on the occasion of the 86th anniversary of the formation of an independent state, its national day.
 The message sincerely wished the president great success in his responsible work for the country's prosperity, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two peoples would grow stronger in their interests.

articles.title: Turkish Prime Minister Greeted
articles.content:
Turkish Prime Minister Greeted
    Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Recep Tayyip Erdogan, prime minister of the Republic of Turkey, on the occasion of the day of the proclamation of the republic.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the prime minister greater success in his responsible work for the independent development of the country.    
 Paek Nam Sun, minister of Foreign Affairs, sent a similar message to Abdullah Gul, deputy prime minister and foreign minister of Turkey.

articles.title: Czech Prime Minister Greeted
articles.content:
Czech Prime Minister Greeted
    Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Stanislav Gross, prime minister of the Czech Republic, on the occasion of the 86th anniversary of the formation of the independent state, the national day of the country.
 The message wished Stanislav Gross success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples.    
 Paek Nam Sun, minister of Foreign Affairs, sent a similar message to Cyril Svoboda, deputy prime minister and foreign minister of the Czech Republic.

Message of Sympathy to Chongryon Chairman
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Chongryon Chairman
    Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of sympathy to So Man Sul, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), upon hearing the news that a strong earthquake caused serious damage to the Koreans in Japan in Juetsu, Niigata Prefecture.
 Expressing deep sympathy to the Chongryon Central Standing Committee and Koreans in the quake-stricken area, the message hoped that the Chongryon officials and Koreans would eradicate the aftermath of the quake at an early date, bring the living of Koreans in the quake-hit area to normal by their concerted efforts and carry on their vigorous patriotic movement.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Japan Red Cross
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Japan Red Cross
    Pyongyang, October 28 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society sent a message of sympathy to the Japan Red Cross.
 The message said: Upon hearing the news that an earthquake hit Niigata Prefecture on Oct. 23, causing big casualties and economic loss, we express deep consolation to the victims and wish you success in your work to eradicate the aftermath of the earthquake at the earliest and bring the living of the people in the afflicted area to normal.
